Class Vehicle

java.lang.Object
greenfoot.Actor
SuperSmoothMover
Vehicle
public abstract class Vehicle extends SuperSmoothMover
This is the superclass for Vehicles.

  • Method Details

    • checkHitPedestrian

      protected abstract boolean checkHitPedestrian()

    • addedToWorld

      public void addedToWorld(greenfoot.World w)
      This method is called automatically when the Vehicle is added to the World, and places the Vehicle just off screen (centered 100 pixels beyond the center of the lane spawner) so it will appear to roll onto the screen smoothly.
      Overrides:
      addedToWorld in class greenfoot.Actor

    • act

      public void act()
      The superclass Vehicle's act() method. This can be called by a Vehicle subclass object (for example, by a Car) in two ways: - If the Vehicle simply does NOT have a method called public void act(), this will be called instead. - subclass' act() method can invoke super.act() to call this, as is demonstrated here.
      Overrides:
      act in class greenfoot.Actor

    • checkEdge

      protected boolean checkEdge()
      A method used by all Vehicles to check if they are at the edge. Note that this World is set to unbounded (The World's super class is (int, int, int, FALSE) which means that objects should not be stopped from leaving the World. However, this introduces a challenge as there is the potential for objects to disappear off-screen but still be fully acting and thus wasting resources and affecting the simulation even though they are not visible.

    • repelPedestrians

      public void repelPedestrians()

    • pushAwayFromObjects

      public void pushAwayFromObjects(ArrayList<greenfoot.Actor> nearbyObjects, double minDistance)
      New repel method! Seems to work well. Can be used in both directions, but for now commented out movement on x so players are only "repelled" in a y-direction.
      Since:
      February 2023

    • drive

      public void drive()
      Method that deals with movement. Speed can be set by individual subclasses in their constructors

    • getSpeed

      public double getSpeed()
      An accessor that can be used to get this Vehicle's speed. Used, for example, when a vehicle wants to see if a faster vehicle is ahead in the lane.

    • getTowed

      public void getTowed(Vehicle towtruck)
      Tell the vehicle that it is being towed and by who
